member.summary: Sets the data for the Dataset.

member.summary: Sets the data for the Dataset.

member.summary: Sets the data for the Dataset.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.Base(System.Int32)
member.summary: Base value for the bar in data units along the value axis. If not set, defaults to the value axis base value.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BarPercentage(System.Double)
member.summary: Percent (0-1) of the available width each bar should be within the category width. 1.0 will take the whole category width and put the bars right next to each other. Default 0.9

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BarThickness(System.Int32)
member.summary: If this value is a number, it is applied to the width of each bar, in pixels. When this is enforced, barPercentage and categoryPercentage are ignored.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BarThickness(System.String)
member.summary: If set to 'flex', the base sample widths are calculated automatically based on the previous and following samples so that they take the full available widths without overlap. Then, bars are sized using barPercentage and categoryPercentage. There is no gap when the percentage options are 1. This mode generates bars with different widths when data are not evenly spaced.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BorderSkipped(RazorKit.Skipped)
member.summary: This setting is used to avoid drawing the bar stroke at the base of the fill, or disable the border radius. In general, this does not need to be changed except when creating chart types that derive from a bar chart.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BorderSkipped(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Skip all borders (true), or don't skip any borders (false).

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BorderWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: If this value is a number, it is applied to all sides of the rectangle (left, top, right, bottom), except borderSkipped. Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BorderWidth(System.Action{RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BorderWidthBuilder})
member.summary: If this value is an object, the left property defines the left border width. Similarly, the right, top, and bottom properties can also be specified. Omitted borders and borderSkipped are skipped.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BorderRadius(System.Int32)
member.summary: If this value is a number, it is applied to all corners of the rectangle (topLeft, topRight, bottomLeft, bottomRight), except corners touching the borderSkipped. Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.BorderRadius(System.Action{RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BorderRadiusBuilder})
member.summary: If this value is an object, the topLeft property defines the top-left corners border radius. Similarly, the topRight, bottomLeft, and bottomRight.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.CategoryPercentage(System.Double)
member.summary: Percent (0-1) of the available width each category should be within the sample width.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.Grouped(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Should the bars be grouped on index axis. When true, all the datasets at same index value will be placed next to each other centering on that index value. When false, each bar is placed on its actual index-axis value. Default true

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.HoverBorderRadius(System.Int32)
member.summary: The bar border radius when hovered (in pixels). Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.IndexAxis(RazorKit.IndexAxis)
member.summary: The base axis of the dataset. 'x' for vertical bars and 'y' for horizontal bars.

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.Order(System.Int32)
member.summary: The drawing order of dataset. Also affects order for stacking, tooltip and legend. Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.PointStyle(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Is style of the point enabled?

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.PointStyle(RazorKit.PointStyle)
member.summary: Style of the point. Default 'circle'

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.BarDatasetBuilder.SkipNull(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If true, null or undefined values will not be used for spacing calculations when determining bar size.

member.summary: Stroke width around the text. Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.Z(System.Int32)

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.Align(RazorKit.TicksAlign)
member.summary: The tick alignment along the axis. 'inner' alignment means align 'start' for first tick and 'end' for the last tick of horizontal axis. Default 'center'

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.CrossAlign(RazorKit.TicksCrossAlign)
member.summary: The tick alignment perpendicular to the axis. Default 'near'

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.SampleSize(System.Int32)
member.summary: The number of ticks to examine when deciding how many labels will fit. Setting a smaller value will be faster, but may be less accurate when there is large variability in label length. Default ticks.length

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.AutoSkip(System.Boolean)
member.summary: If true, automatically calculates how many labels can be shown and hides labels accordingly. Labels will be rotated up to maxRotation before skipping any. Turn autoSkip off to show all labels no matter what. Default true

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.AutoSkipPadding(System.Int32)
member.summary: Padding between the ticks on the horizontal axis when autoSkip is enabled. Default 3

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.IncludeBounds(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Should the defined min and max values be presented as ticks even if they are not "nice". Default true

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.LabelOffset(System.Int32)
member.summary: Distance in pixels to offset the label from the centre point of the tick (in the x-direction for the x-axis, and the y-direction for the y-axis). Note: this can cause labels at the edges to be cropped by the edge of the canvas. Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.MaxRotation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maximum rotation for tick labels when rotating to condense labels. Note: Rotation doesn't occur until necessary. Note: Only applicable to horizontal scales. Default 50

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.MinRotation(System.Int32)
member.summary: Minimum rotation for tick labels. Note: Only applicable to horizontal scales. Default 0

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.Mirror(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Flips tick labels around axis, displaying the labels inside the chart instead of outside. Note: Only applicable to vertical scales. Default false

member.name: M:RazorKit.ChartJs.Builders.TicksBuilder.MaxTicksLimit(System.Int32)
member.summary: Maximum number of ticks and gridlines to show. Default 11

member.name: T:RazorKit.JoinStyle
member.summary: There are three possible values for this property: "round", "bevel", and "miter". The default is "miter".

member.name: F:RazorKit.JoinStyle.Miter
member.summary: Connected segments are joined by extending their outside edges to connect at a single point, with the effect of filling an additional lozenge-shaped area. This setting is effected by the miterLimit property.

member.name: F:RazorKit.JoinStyle.Round
member.summary: Rounds off the corners of a shape by filling an additional sector of disc centered at the common endpoint of connected segments. The radius for these rounded corners is equal to the line width.

member.name: F:RazorKit.JoinStyle.Bevel
member.summary: Fills an additional triangular area between the common endpoint of connected segments, and the separate outside rectangular corners of each segment.

member.name: F:RazorKit.Algorithm.Lttb
member.summary: Lttb decimation reduces the number of data points significantly. This is most useful for showing trends in data using only a few data points.

member.name: F:RazorKit.Algorithm.MinMax
member.summary: Min/max decimation will preserve peaks in your data but could require up to 4 points for each pixel. This type of decimation would work well for a very noisy signal where you need to see data peaks.
